name: rape seed production | rape seed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9398/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of rape seed (fresh matter). The yield is 3020 kg/ha at a moisture content at storage of 10%.;;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

This activity starts after the harvest of the previous crop. The inputs of seeds, mineral fertilisers and pesticides are considered. It is assumed that no organic fertilisers are applied.


The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, combine-harvest and transport from field to farm (2 km). Further, direct field emissions are included. This activity ends after harvest at the farm gate.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The yield data have been collected for the years 2000-2004.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Refers to an average production in the region Barrois (FR).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: conventional production typical for the region
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data come from a survey in the concerted action GL-Pro of the EU (QLK5-CT-2002-02418). Data were compiled from statistics, pilot networks, fertilising recommendations, documents from extension services, information provided by retailers and expert knowledge. The production data were verified and adjusted by a group of experts in GL-Pro and by other experts.

Calculated value. Land use change (LUC) combines land transformation areas calculated with the adapted 'Direct Land Use Change Assessment Tool' version 2014 developed by Blonk Consultants and the carbon losses from soil organic carbon (SOC) and vegetation (VEG) as calculated in ecoinvent v3. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'rape seed' is calculated to be circa 1.15E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'lime', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.31E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Modelled, see chapter 'Emissions of heavy metals to agricultural soil, surface water and ground water' in "01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf" - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation)
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of rape seed is calculated to be circa 9.42E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'cyclic N-compound', 'dinitroaniline-compound', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'pyrethroid-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.88E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
